Estimate the Treatment Mechanism (Propensity Score)

Source: R/estimate-propensity_score.R
est_g.Rd

Compute the propensity score (treatment mechanism) for the observed data, including the shift. This returns the propensity score for the observed data (at A_i) and the shift of interest (at A_i - delta).

est_g(A, W, delta = 0, ipc_weights = rep(1, length(A)),
  fit_type = c("sl", "glm"), sl_lrnrs_dens = NULL,
  std_args = list(nbins = 25, bin_method = "dhist", bin_estimator =
  condensier::speedglmR6$new(), parfit = FALSE))

Arguments

A

A numeric vector of observed treatment values.
W

A numeric matrix of observed baseline covariate values.
delta

A numeric value identifying a shift in the observed value of the treatment under which observations are to be evaluated.
ipc_weights

A numeric vector of observation-level weights, as produced by the internal procedure to estimate the censoring mechanism estimate-ipc_weights.
fit_type

A character specifying whether to use Super Learner to fit the density estimation.
sl_lrnrs_dens

An object containing a set of instantiated learners from the sl3 package, to be used in fitting an ensemble model.
std_args

A list of arguments to be passed to fit_density from the condensier package when the argument fit_type is set to "glm" (not invoking Super Learner).

Contents

  • Arguments
